content: Ask my doctor or pharmacist to only give me small amounts of medication at a time
Doctors and pharmacists may have some flexibility in how much medication they prescribe at one time. Having fewer pills on hand may make it safer for you in times of crisis.
Ask the doctor or pharmacist how many pills they are prescribing. If it seems like a lot, ask if they could prescribe a smaller number – only one month’s worth instead of three month’s, for example.
